snippet: The report from a rights advocacy group is the most detailed external account of other countries’ assistance in the agency’s secret detention, rendition and interrogation program.
abstract: Report by Open Society Justice Initiative documents broad international involvement in American campaign against Al Qaeda, showing that some 54 countries helped facilitate Central Intelligence Agency's secret detention, rendition and interrogation program in years after Sept 11, 2001, terrorist attacks.
lead_paragraph: The report from a rights advocacy group is the most detailed external account of other countries’ assistance in the agency’s secret detention, rendition and interrogation program.

headline.seo: Report Says 54 Countries Helped C.I.A. With Interrogations After 9/11
headline.main: Report Says 54 Countries Helped C.I.A. After 9/11
headline.print_headline: Report Says 54 Countries Helped C.I.A. After 9/11
